description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7mugc","text":"Here we describe the full protocol for single-cell Epi2-Seq which enables joint readout of histone modifications and DNA methylation in individual cells. In short, this methods combines antibody-targeted MNase digestion (ChIC, CUT\u0026RUN) with Tet-Assisted Pyridine Borane Sequencing (TAPS), a bisulfite-free technique for base-resolution DNA methylation profiling. TAPS, unlike bisulfite, specifically converts 5mC which increases mapping rates and makes it feasible to use unmethylated single-cell adapters. Also, DNA damage is minimal which reduces input requirements and makes it well suited for single-cell applications. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
